content: all in one crocodile - amigurumi pattern by criss wall i have a huge collection of scrap balls of yarn i really wanted to use them instead of throwing them out so i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find they turned out to be so popular i just can t stop making them i wanted to create a small series of patterns that take around 30-40 mins to complete and do not involve sewing additional parts onto the work when you are finished this particular pattern i embroider on after but you can leave the toys plain too my pattern contains basic instructions meant for someone who is already familiar crocheting amigurumi stitches  chain chain  single_crochet single_crochet  increase increase  decrease decrease  bobble complete this stitch quite loosely it sits much better when it isn t tight it can be your choice of 5 6 or 8 double_crochet s in one stitch i just like 8 double_crochet s as they sit out a bit more to the sides you can also use a popcorn puff or cluster as long as the stitch points outwards when it is done supplies  preferably two different colours of yarn one for the nose and scutes and one for the body but again the crocodiles look fine in one colour  6mm safety eyes but you can easily use a french knot or sew your eyes on later  stuffing & a needle  i usually don t add hook sizes to my patterns these little toys are mostly made with scrap yarn that you have at home and you would use an appropriate hook size with it but as a guide i use 3 0-3 5mm for dk/8ply and 3 5-4mm for aran/10ply criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-crocodile-alligator instructions body work in the round without joining row you will need to keep track of the beginning of each row for this pattern either use a piece of scrap yarn or stitch markers the feet need to be placed in certain stitches so the crocodile is sitting flat row 1 single_crochet 6 into a magic_ring and pull tight 6 stitches row 2 single_crochet 3 increase single_crochet 2 7 stitches row 3 single_crochet 3 increase single_crochet 3 8 stitches row 4 single_crochet 4 increase single_crochet 3 9 stitches row 5 single_crochet around 9 stitches row 6 single_crochet 4 increase x 3 single_crochet 2 12 stitches row 7 single_crochet 5 increase x 3 single_crochet 4 15 stitches row 8 - 9 single_crochet 15 around 15 stitches row 10 *decrease single_crochet 1* repeat around 10 stitches row 11 *increase single_crochet 1* repeat around 15 stitches row 12 *increase single_crochet 2* repeat around 20 stitches row 13 see bobble note above 8dc bobble in next stitch single_crochet 5 8dc bobble in next stitch single_crochet 13 20 stitches push the bobbles inside out so that they are poking to the outside of the work row 14 single_crochet 20 around
